title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Make a real product with Gemini

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this video explains "prompt chaining" using a context file to teach an AI about a project's history and then uses the Gemini web app as a Project Manager. It shows how Gemini can write technical instructions for the Gemini CLI to build complex features (example: invoice generation) and points viewers to a full course with interactive demos and labs.
bullets: Introduces prompt chaining and the use of context files to capture project history.
Demonstrates the Gemini web app acting as a Project Manager.
Shows generation of technical instructions for Gemini CLI to implement features.
Example use case: building an invoice generation feature.
Full course link provided for interactive demos and labs.
takeaways: Capturing project history in context files helps preserve operational knowledge for repeatable automation.
Using Gemini as a Project Manager can standardize instruction generation for CLI-driven deployments and feature builds.
AI-generated technical instructions can accelerate development workflows and reduce manual handoffs.
Interactive courses and labs are available for teams to learn and adopt these practices safely.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description, KPMG Poland discusses how AI has moved from future promise to everyday use in audit, supporting repetitive tasks, large‑scale data analysis and decision making. Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska outline concrete tools (np. AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI, KPMG Clara), changes in auditor roles and competencies, and implementation challenges including data security and regulatory issues.
bullets: AI supports repetitive audit tasks and analysis of full populations rather than sampling.
Presented tools include AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI (conversational assistants/agents) and the KPMG Clara platform.
KPMG Clara enables real‑time management of audits and Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
Adoption shifts auditor roles and requires new competencies and adaptation.
Key challenges: implementation, data security, regulatory environment and potential AI‑related risks.
takeaways: Expect audits to leverage full‑population data analysis, which can increase accuracy and change audit timing and scope.
Real‑time audit platforms and client portals can streamline communication and reduce administrative friction during reviews.
Data security and compliance with regulatory requirements are critical when audits incorporate AI—ensure infrastructure and policies meet standards.
Reskilling and access to audit‑focused AI tools will influence how internal teams interact with external auditors and manage evidence.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Copilot provides real-time support for home projects and repairs. It can see what you see and offers step-by-step instructions and clear guidance for issues like leaky pipes and overflowing washing machines.
bullets: Real-time visual assistance that observes the user’s environment.
Step-by-step instructions for home repairs and projects.
Examples include plumbing issues and appliance overflows.
Focus on clear, actionable guidance for non-experts.
Designed for immediate, on-the-spot troubleshooting.
takeaways: Real-time visual, step-by-step guidance described could be applied to on-site troubleshooting workflows in grid and data center environments.
Seeing what the user sees may help remote technicians diagnose issues faster, potentially reducing unnecessary on-site dispatches.
Clear, actionable instructions could improve first-time fix rates and reduce reliance on specialist visits.
Implementing similar capabilities would need alignment with existing site procedures, safety protocols, and technician workflows.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer highlights support for NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The game is a 3D real-time strategy RPG in which you play the Endministrator exploring Talos-II, and the trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X mode.
bullets: Official launch of Arknights: Endfield, a 3D real-time strategy RPG.
Trailer showcases NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Captured on GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra Settings using DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode.
Game premise: play as the Endministrator of Endfield Industries exploring Talos-II.
Publisher and NVIDIA GeForce promote official social channels and community portal.
takeaways: DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation is being used in 4K capture—verify infrastructure compatibility with DLSS 4 and RTX 50-series GPUs if supporting high-res cloud/streaming workloads.
Trailers captured on RTX 5080 indicate a need to consider GPU generation when planning hardware refreshes or capacity for premium 4K real-time rendering.
Assess software/driver support and deployment workflows to enable DLSS 4 features in hosted or streamed gaming services.
For high-fidelity content delivery, evaluate resource allocation (GPU, bitrate, encoder) to accommodate 4K Ultra content captured with advanced frame-generation modes.

items.title: New CO2 Battery Stores 8 Hours of Energy

ai.summary: Based on the available description… A giant bubble of carbon dioxide can store 20 megawatts of energy. The description says these batteries are intended to smooth renewable energy fluctuations and help power a global shift to clean energy.
bullets: Giant carbon dioxide bubble-based battery can store 20 megawatts of energy.
Designed to address fluctuations in renewable energy generation.
Positioned as a technology to support a global transition to clean energy.
Presented in the video description with related tech and energy hashtags.
takeaways: 20 MW of storage capacity could be considered for balancing variable renewable output on a grid.
Such storage technology, if deployed, may support decarbonization and reliability planning for utilities.
Data centers evaluating renewable integration may view this as a potential option for additional backup or smoothing capacity.
